subject: Re: PD Warrior page amendments
preview: Hi Janina, Ok sure, confirming this has been updated too.

full_threads.body:
Hi Janina, 

Ok sure, confirming this has been updated too.

Thanks Heath.

One last change on my end. Please see below - can we align the image and the text?



J

JANINA HIPOLITO​

MARKETING SPECIALIST

E.

Janina.Hipolito@royalrehab.com.au

Hi Janina, 

Confirming we have made the below changes for you: 
https://royalrehab2020.wpperk.cloud/private-hospital/day-rehabilitation-programs/pd_warrior/

Hi Heath, No worries 😊 I'll organise a call with you sometime this week to discuss the website migration and what it means for me in regards to publishing stories, making changes etc. For now, I'll give you the changes. Please see below - let me know if anything is confusing! Thanks, Janina
  • "What is PD Warrior" section is duplicated. Please remove the first "What is PD Warrior" paragraph.
  • Can we swap image placements? Can we put the image in "The right program for you" up next to "What is PD Warrior"? The other image can go down next to "The right program for you".
  • Can we remove the H2 "A recent survey of PD Warriors showed…" Keep the stats but just remove the heading.
  • For the H2 "Multidisciplinary Programs" can we update this to "Benefit from our multidisciplinary approach"
  • I have also edited the last two paragraphs. Please update the below text.
Benefit from our multidisciplinary approach PD Warrior is part of the Day Rehab program at Royal Rehab Private Hospital. The Day Rehabilitation program is a multidisciplinary approach to physical rehabilitation that includes a minimum of two disciplines personalised to suit your needs. Other services offered by Royal Rehab Private Hospital include LSVT BIG and LSVT LOUD, (internationally renowned programs for Parkinson's disease), exercise physiology, physiotherapy, hydrotherapy, speech pathology, occupational therapy and dietetics. Each of our Day Rehabilitation programs run for a minimum of 1.5 hours (half day) or up to 3 hours (full day). Referrals and funding To access the Day Rehab program, patients require GP referral and a completed Royal Rehab Private Day program referral form. Patients may be eligible for full funding through their health fund, third party or stakeholder (DVA, CTP, Workers Compensation), or be willing to self-fund the sessions. Please note, this program can be funded through most major health insurance companies. For more information on PD Warrior or on our Day Rehabilitation program, please contact (02) 9808 0522 to discuss. JANINA HIPOLITO​ MARKETING SPECIALIST E. Janina.Hipolito@royalrehab.com.au

Morning Janina, 

Ok sure, but I don't think you have access to the new site as yet? If you are updating things on the live site, they won't be carried across to the new site. 

I can talk you through this if needed. Perhaps in the short term if you want to send the changes through we can do them for you. Keep in mind the link I sent you is not live to the public, so no rush if that makes sense?

Hey Heath,

Just an update, I'll try to work through the updates myself on the back end.

Thanks,

Janina

JANINA HIPOLITO​

MARKETING SPECIALIST

E.

Janina.Hipolito@royalrehab.com.au

Hey Heath,

Apologies I have a few minor edits to make which I'll send through first thing tomorrow morning 😊

Thanks,

Janina

JANINA HIPOLITO​

MARKETING SPECIALIST

E.

Janina.Hipolito@royalrehab.com.au

Hi Heath,

I'm really happy with this one!

This is approved on my end.

Thanks,

Janina

JANINA HIPOLITO​

MARKETING SPECIALIST

E.

Janina.Hipolito@royalrehab.com.au

Hi Janina,

Thanks for the below, confirming we have made the updates, https://royalrehab2020.wpperk.cloud/private-hospital/day-rehabilitation-programs/pd_warrior/

Let us know if you would like any further tweaks?

Speak soon,

HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU

E. heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

This looks great!


We have some edits to add. Ideally this would be completed today so we can go-live with this asap 😊 Apologies for the essay, all the below amendments should be relatively minor. Any questions, let me know!

  • Let's change the tag-line in the heading to "Parkinson's Disease Exercise Program, Sydney"
  • For the main tagline underneath the heading, can we please shorten to "Exercise is important for everyone, but if you have Parkinson's disease exercise can be vital to help you live the life you want". We will need to remove the 2nd sentence completely.
  • Under "What is PD Warrior?" can we update the paragraph to below (I have just included internationally renowned):

PD Warrior is an exciting new addition to Royal Rehab's existing multidisciplinary rehab program. This internationally renowned group-based program helps both the physical and cognitive symptoms that occur with Parkinson's disease, in a fun and social way. The program uses a unique combination of physical and cognitive activities, to drive your brain's natural ability to re-wire itself through neuroplastic change. This helps to improve bodily movement and to delay the onset of severe symptoms of the disease. Expect success with PD Warrior - your new exercise regime, support network and motivational coach all in one.

  • I love the purple icon next to "What is PD Warrior" however can we please replace this with an image? I have sent the image in a separate link.
  • Can we minimise the size of the purple icon and perhaps put it as a circle within the heading somehow? We can do this for all the pages.
  • We love the stats scrolling. Is there anyway to keep this moving a little bit longer? It lands very quickly onto the final stats.
  • With the stats, can we move the image on the right into the middle in between the stat squares?
  • We would like to include H2 sub-headings for the final paragraph regarding funding and split it into two (please see below).

Multidisciplinary Programs

PD Warrior is part of the Day Rehab program at Royal Rehab Private Hospital. The Day Rehabilitation program is a multidisciplinary approach to physical rehabilitation that includes a minimum of two disciplines personalised to suit your needs. Other services include LSVT BIG and LSVT LOUD, (internationally renowned programs for Parkinson's disease), exercise physiology, physiotherapy, hydrotherapy, speech pathology, occupational therapy and dietetics.

Our Day Rehabilitation program runs for a minimum of 1.5 hours (half day) or up to 3 hours (full day).

Referrals and Funding

Patients must be eligible in the form of a GP referral and a completed Royal Rehab Private Day program referral form. Patients must also be fully-funded through their health fund, third party or stakeholder (DVA, CTP, Workers Compensation), or be willing to self-fund the sessions. Please note, this program can be funded through most major health insurance companies. For more information on PD Warrior or on our Day Rehabilitation program, please contact (02) 9808 0522 to discuss.

Also can we change the copy in the last para where it reads "Patients must be eligible in the form of a GP referral and a completed Royal Rehab Private Day program referral form.'' to read ''To attend our Day Rehab you require a referral from a general practitioner and a completed Day Rehab referral form. <then provide a link to these forms on the Referral page>.
JANINA HIPOLITO​
MARKETING SPECIALIST
E.
 Janina.Hipolito@Royalrehab.com.au
